info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 5 at 4:23PM EDT until May 5 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Broward.
* WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 423 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Lauderhill, Weston, Sawgrass Mills Mall, Intersection I-75 And U.S. 27, East Toll Gate On Alligator Alley, Pine Island Ridge, Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley, Broadview Park and Markham Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING
